text.section:
To enforce this subtitle, the Authority may:
hear complaints for violations of this subtitle;
after a hearing, assess a civil penalty under § 12-135 of this subtitle; and
reach a settlement instead of assessing a civil penalty.

section.section:
The Authority may:
establish reasonable complaint filing fees and administrative fees for complaints heard by the Authority; and
use the services of a third party to collect civil penalties.
If the Authority determines that an individual cannot afford to pay a fee established under paragraph (1)(i) of this subsection, the Authority may exempt the individual wholly or partly from the fee.

text.section:
The Authority may not assess a civil penalty against a person unless the person:
receives reasonable prior notice of the complaint; and
has an opportunity to be heard under § 12-113 of this subtitle.
